meanings.sent1: She always demurs when asked to try new foods.
meanings.sent2: He demurs at the idea of going on a roller coaster.
meanings.sent3: The cat demurs at the sight of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The student demurs from participating in the group project.
meanings.sent5: The child demurs from eating vegetables, wrinkling his nose in distaste.

meanings.definition: The action of objecting or hesitating.
meanings.sent1: Her demurs during the meeting caused a delay in decision-making.
meanings.sent2: The manager noted the employee's demurs during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's demurs at bath time were quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The demurs of the jury hinted at their uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The audience's demurs were evident in their hesitant applause.
